byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

abstract: Details emerging from terrorist attacks in Brussels, including odd smells and occurrences at housing block where attackers lived, reveal series of clues for lengthy bomb-making preparation that went undetected by Belgian authorities; issue has stirred anger and dismay among the public and country's European allies.
lead_paragraph: Only on the morning of the attacks did chemical odors and other strange hints come together to form a clear picture of what had been happening at the apartment used as a bomb-making workshop.

headline.main: In Brussels Bombing Plot, a Trail of Dots Not Connected
headline.print_headline: In Belgian Plot, a Trail of Dots Not Connected

snippet: Only on the morning of the attacks did chemical odors and other strange hints come together to form a clear picture of what had been happening at the apartment used as a bomb-making workshop.
